attributes.action: stop conning the British public into believing their views matter and remove this E-Petitions facility.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As proved recently, following the extremely popular petition against road pricing, the Government will carry on regardless of the views of the electorate. Stop this pretence of democratic process and pull the E-Petitions facility from this Government website.

"The Government is to press ahead with preparations for nationwide congestion charging despite the millionth signature on a petition opposing the idea.

An experiment in internet democracy, in which people were invited to place petitions on the No 10 website and vote for them by e-mail, has embarrassed ministers. 

The petition calling on the Government “to scrap the vehicle tracking and road-pricing policy” was due to gain its millionth signature last night, less than three months after it was posted on the website."

Ben Webster, Transport Correspondent, Times Online

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
